Portal was sort of a little experiment of a huge company. That’s why success of the first part of the Portal was a surprise even for the VALVE. Therefore seriously question arose about the Portal 2. And what we got? Let's see.

　STILL ALIVE?

　　The game begins with the fact that Chell along with her new partner, personality module Wheatley, is trying to escape from an abandoned Aperture Science laboratory. Throughout the game, the plot makes a interesting twists. Individual deserves compliments perfect finale, after which there remain only a warm feeling. In Portal 2 no epic stories, huge explosions, incredible action, or the salvation of humanity. Instead, there is a charismatic characters, intelligent humor and interesting puzzles.

　ONE IS GOOD, BUT TWO IS BETTER

　　One of the achievements of the new Portal has been the emergence of the cooperative. Co-op story is a continuation of the plot of the single player. At first I thought that the only difference of the cooperative is the presence of two players with portal-guns, instead of one. In fact, the cooperative has unique ideas. Many puzzles solving quite differently. I advise you not to play cooperative with a random person (there is that possibility), and play it with a good friend.

　ENDLESS TESTS

　　In game was added a level editor, so anyone can create their own test chambers or try to play the levels of other players. To be honest, most of the player-created levels are too simple or ridiculous. But there is sufficient interesting maps (and some of them really hard). In no case do not miss the community maps.

　Multiplayer:
　　Online: Θ Θ Θ Θ Θ Θ Θ Θ Θ Θ 
　　Co-op: ☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺O
　Storyline: ☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺O
　Graphics: ☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺O
　Gameplay: ☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺

　

　Complexity of the achievements: All achievements can be easily earned (if you have good friend for the co-op) in the one-two walkthrough.

　　　　VALVE made another good
　　game. With good intelligent humor,
　　charismatic characters and unusual
　　interesting gameplay.

　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　As expected, nine out of ten [9/10].

This is perhaps my favourite game, ever.  The puzzles are exciting, and they all feel like they have unique solutions, even though there are a limited number of elements from which the puzzles are built.  It's such a rush to say, "Oh, I can do *that*!"

The game builds on the strengths of the last game, adding a set of tests like in the original, but then you enter the *old* testing grounds, with a host of new elements and ideas.  The single-player mode is about three times as long as the first Portal, with different phases and different enemies along the way.  The co-operative mode is an entire second game that is just as challenging as the single-player, though less varied.  I'm playing it through with my son right now, but I imagine it would be near impossible just using gestures.

The characters are absolutely brilliant.  GLaDOS, Wheatley, and Cave Johnson provide hilarious banter, with Ellen McLain's GLaDOS standing out because of her incredible character development.  Nothing beats solving puzzles while being taunted by a passive-aggressive, psychopathic robot.

I'm only sorry that the game ended.  It's not very replayable, since you only get the rush of solving the puzzles once (something the game actually alludes to in game), not that that stopped me.  Awesome game.  10/10.

What can I say that hasn't been said before? This game is absolutely stunning, with amazing personality, charming characters, mysterious plot and tight gameplay. The puzzle solving will test your ability to connect different situations and it truly is a fantastic thing to solve a puzzle that you have been stuck in for hours. The controls are tight and you feel in power of all of your movements, as in any Source game. The multiplayer is great and fun, as long as you have a microphone, trying to play this with just the text chat or the in-game pointing system just doesn't quite cut it. I hope they continue the franchise some time in the future and they continue the story of Chell. If you have a medium-tier PC, you can totally run this game without a problem and expierence of the best games of the modern era. 9/10

Les énigmes sont amusantes mais n'atteignent jamais le niveau du casse-tête. L'univers et l'histoire sont originaux et très bien menés, une belle aventure de moins de 10 heures.

Ce jeu est la suite fameux Portal. C'est un puzzle game qui prend place dans un labo de recherche. Vous êtes un sujet de test et vous allez récupérer un "Portal gun" qui, comme son nom l'indique, crée des portails de téléportation.

Quelques raison de l'acheter : 

-Sans doute un des plus célèbres de sa génération
-un gameplay amusant
-des graphisme pas mal
-un grand nombre de niveaux
-un mode Coop avec des niveaux exclusifs
-un mod gratuit sortit ("Thinking With Time Machine") + Un mod payant sortit ("Aperture Tag: The Paint Gun Testing Initiative") + un mod à venir ("Conversion")
-des cartes créées par la communauté
-un éditeur de niveaux assez complet

Quelques raisons de ne pas l'acheter : 

-Son prix (19.99€)
-sa durée de vie (~9 heures pour le solo)
In my opinion this is the best puzzle game, in fact this is my favirote game of all time. If you are into puzzles and some witty comdey on the side this game is definetley worth looking at!

Это действительно лучший шедевр от Valve! Аналогов этой игре в мире нет. Нам необходимо постоянно идти вперёд несмотря на преграды. Ведь эти преграды очень сложно пройти даже с помощью порталов. Для успешного решения головоломок нужно осмотреться и провести анализ помещения, Даже самая незначительная, спрятанная деталь может оказаться ключом к решению головоломки. После прохождения сюжета можно поиграть в карты, созданные сообществом, или даже самому создать таковые. Это очень увлекательно и интересно!

This game is GREAT!! I highly reccomend Portal 2 to anyone who loves getting stumped, coming back and feeling the joy of completing that one puzzle.

If you didn't play Portal 1, don't let that put you off from playing Portal 2. I myself was hesitant at first for this reason.

Portal 2 isn't a game about blasting stuff into oblivion or using mind-wracking puzzles to drive you to insanity. Instead the game teaches you a bit of a life lesson: Perserverance. Without giving away too much of the story (what exists of it), you will be solving little tests... some easy as pushing a button and racing across the room. Some hard such as diverting beams of light in front of sentry turrets and deactivating force fields so your platform can carry you across the toxic water below. All the way you will be crucially analyzed and hazed by GlaDos (Don't worry, you'll love her). Her soothign voice attempting to grind you into insanity while playfully informing you that she is just teasing (for the most part). Philosophically, the game is genius. You will be tested through out life and forced to reevaluate decisions that you have made. People will criticize you. But you do this all... for the love of science.

Looking forwarding to seeing more tie-ins between Aperture Science and Black Mesa.

Portal 2 is easily not only the best game on Steam, but also one of the greatest games I've ever played. This game manages to re-invent the first person shooter genre in wonderful ways. The first thing: this may be an FPS, but it doesn't mean you go around shooting things. This game is about using this viewpoint to solve puzzles that aren't the hardest puzzles you'll encounter, but instead warp your mind into "thinking with portals". The gameplay is solid, and the inclusion of gels in this game adds a layer of complexity not present in the first Portal. The story and voice acting are also a joy, and the graphics have taken a huge step up in quality. All in all, a solid step up from the already good Portal, presenting a true masterpiece of a sequel.
